World.title: Minute's silence held to remember Bondi beach attack victims
World.description: Australian Prime Minister Anthony Albanese was booed as he arrived at the memorial event.

World.title: Russia-Ukraine war may “grind on for another 12 to 18 months”
World.description: “These peace negotiations are a farce.”

World.title: Thousands of candidates sit for government exam on airstrip in India
World.description: More than 8,000 candidates sat for a government exam on a runway in Odisha in India.

World.title: Gunmen kill nine in South Africa tavern attack
World.description: A further 10 people were injured in Bekkersdal after the perpetrators opened fire and "continued to shoot randomly".

World.title: A radio station in Amsterdam is a lifeline for Sudan. After USAID cuts, it's faltering
World.description: Budget cuts threaten the future of Amsterdam-based Radio Dabanga, which has served as an information lifeline for Sudanese people about their war-torn country.

World.title: Algeria bill seeks to criminalise French colonial rule: What to know
World.description: Algerian parliament is set to vote on Wednesday on the draft law, which speaker calls a 'defining milestone'.

World.title: 9 killed, 10 wounded in South African pub shooting
World.description: Authorities report that nine people have died and at least 10 others are injured after a shooting at a South African pub. The incident occurred early Sunday in Bekkersdal, west of Johannesburg.

World.title: Israel’s yellow line in Gaza has become a “site of killing”
World.description: “People don’t know exactly where [Gaza’s yellow line] exists … when they pass it, they become targets.”

World.title: LIVE: Israel continues ceasefire violations; 1 Palestinian killed in Gaza
World.description: One Palestinian killed by Israeli army in Gaza while two Palestinians, including a child, are shot dead in West Bank.

World.title: Australia beat England to win third Test and retain Ashes
World.description: Australia win Adelaide Test against England and forge an unassailable 3-0 lead in cricket's longest running series.

World.title: Jake Paul vs Anthony Joshua: Is this good for Boxing?
World.description: Samantha Johnson looks at how audience, attention and money are reshaping modern boxing.

World.title: Sixty years ago, the world tried to stop racial discrimination and failed
World.description: Decades after the passing of the UN convention on the elimination of discrimination, systemic racism is still rampant.

World.title: Kylian Mbappe equals Ronaldo record in Real Madrid win over Sevilla
World.description: Real Madrid star forward scores his 59th goal in a calendar year to equal Cristiano Ronaldo's record tally at the club.

World.title: US seizes second oil tanker off Venezuela
World.description: Video shows the moment the US military seizes a second oil tanker off the coast of Venezuela.

World.title: Russia says talks on US peace plan for Ukraine 'are proceeding constructively'
World.description: A Kremlin envoy says peace talks in Florida on a U.S.-proposed plan to end the war in Ukraine are proceeding constructively, after U.S. meetings with Ukrainian and European officials in Berlin.

World.title: Trump’s approach to Venezuela “ad hoc, unpredictable”
World.description: Former Pentagon official Adam Clements, talks about the latest seizure by the US of a Venezuelan oil tanker.

World.title: Imran Khan and wife given further jail terms after state gift fraud case
World.description: Pakistan's former PM, who is already serving time in prison, plans to challenge the verdict.

World.title: Australia honours Bondi Beach victims, launches probe of security services
World.description: PM Albanese announces review of Australia's law enforcement and intelligence agencies after deadly Bondi Beach attack.

World.title: Israeli death penalty bill violates international law: Palestinian analysts
World.description: Israel pushes death penalty for Palestinians, prompting accusations of racism and violations of global conventions.

World.title: Survivors 'nervous and sceptical' about release of remaining Epstein files
World.description: US lawmakers who pushed for the documents to be made public have criticised the initial release as incomplete.

World.title: Vigil in London for Palestinian prisoners held in Israel
World.description: Dozens of people gathered in central London on Saturday calling for the release of Palestinian prisoners held in Israel.

World.title: ‘Slap in the face’: Epstein victims slam release of heavily-redacted files
World.description: Outcry comes as US media report that at least 16 files have disappeared from the public webpage for the Epstein files.

World.title: How Israel's grassroots hostage families group became a powerful international force
World.description: With just one hostage left in Gaza, members of the forum reflect on its influence in Israel and abroad.

World.title: South Africa shooting updates: At least 9 people killed near Johannesburg
World.description: At least nine people have been killed and 10 wounded in a mass shooting in the Bekkersdal township.

World.title: Al Jazeera launches new integrative AI model, ‘The Core’
World.description: Al Jazeera Media Network says initiative will shift role of AI 'from passive tool to active partner in journalism'.

World.title: Manhunt under way after gunmen kill nine near South Africa’s Johannesburg
World.description: Motive unknown after about a dozen gunmen in minibus and car target tavern in Bekkersdal township, police say.

World.title: US, Russian officials meet in Miami for talks on Ukraine war
World.description: Russian envoy Kirill Dmitriev says the talks were 'constructive' and will continue on Sunday.

World.title: India express train kills seven elephants crossing tracks
World.description: The collision happened early on Saturday in the north-eastern state of Assam, local officials say.

World.title: Russia-Ukraine war: List of key events, day 1,396
World.description: These are the key developments from day 1,396 of Russia’s war on Ukraine.

World.title: US seizes second oil tanker off Venezuela's coast
World.description: The move comes after US President Donald Trump ordered a "blockade" of sanctioned oil tankers entering and leaving Venezuela.

World.title: Neither Russia nor France: One West African country walks a diplomatic tightrope
World.description: As some West African nations choose to cement old ties with France or a new ally in Russia, Togo wants both.

Politics.title: 'Congress is in a coma.' Former lawmakers sound alarm on health of the House
Politics.description: Congress is wrapping up the year without a lot of legislative accomplishments under its belt and a growing list of lawmakers who are retiring. Former members say the challenges on Capitol Hill have been brewing for a long time.

Politics.title: Apple, Google tell workers on visas to avoid leaving the U.S. amid Trump immigration crackdown
Politics.description: With months-long consulate and embassy delays being reported, the two tech companies say staying put in the U.S. right now could prevent workers from getting stranded in their home countries.

Business.title: Postcode glitch freezes pensioners out of winter heating benefit
Business.description: Customers living in a specific Glasgow postcode were unable to apply for the Warm Home Discount.

Business.title: Takeaway owner delivers 1,000 gifts to children
Business.description: Arfan Mohammed, the owner of Sizzlers Fastfood, delivers 1,000 Christmas gifts to local children.

Culture.title: KPop Demon Hunters' song given classical makeover by Katherine Jenkins
Culture.description: Katherine Jenkins has recorded a classical reinterpretation of a viral song, and learnt a little Korean.

Culture.title: Unexpected comebacks and operatic pop: The best albums and songs of 2025
Culture.description: From Pulp's unexpected comeback to Rosalía's experimental pop, here's the best music of the year.
